programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Eustace battles a beast to bring home a bonus payday. In pursuit of a lion, Jake's team is left hanging on a cliff's edge.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Examining the research of physicist James McDonald, who interviewed more than 500 witnesses of UFOs and reportedly unearthed revealing government documents.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The case of a woman who saw a mysterious flying object in Texas in 1980 and was later hospitalised after losing clumps of hair and patches of skin.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank examine petrol station advertising and memorabilia, and stumble on an exciting piece of motoring history.

programme.title: Barter Kings
programme.desc: When Kendall's car breaks down on the job, Steve and Antonio decide it's time to trade up for some reliable wheels.

programme.title: Barter Kings
programme.desc: The boys need some super-sized wheels to take their families back and forth to the new trading post in Utah. But their gamble to trade up to an RV lands them in Las Vegas with their wives, a wedding, and the King!.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron challenges his protege Leonard to a big rig contest, and the crew works on a rare 1950s British motorcycle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Funk singer George Clinton challenges Rick and the team to return a 1920s grand piano to its former glory.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les ignores Ashley's cries to up security after she finds a potential robber hiding in the shop fridge, and it's a move he may regret come nightfall..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finds himself unable to stop spending, and is under pressure to make sales before being branded a hoarder.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto talks to experts in the world of artificial intelligence and investigates Facebook's AI project, which was shut down in 2017.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into some of the cases described in previously classified UFO files that were released in the UK.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Funk singer George Clinton challenges Rick and the team to return a 1920s grand piano to its former glory.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a 1950s table hockey game while the team work on a slot machine that rewards winners with cigars instead of money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les ignores Ashley's cries to up security after she finds a potential robber hiding in the shop fridge, and it's a move he may regret come nightfall..

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finds himself unable to stop spending, and is under pressure to make sales before being branded a hoarder.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four former contestants return for a second chance, with the two finallists charged with creating a hook sword.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: An eye-opening look into the mysteries and allure of scientology in which former practitioners reveal what drew them to the Church, and why they chose to leave.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 2008, the UK's Ministry of Defence released decades' worth of classified UFO files to the public. One month later, UFO hysteria ripped through the country. Here, the team probes some of the largest sightings of alleged UFOs ever recorded over the English Channel, including two eerie bright-yellow flat objects spotted by pilots in 2007.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zachary Quinto goes scuba diving, spelunking and mountain climbing through the Mediterranean in search of the site of the fabled city of Atlantis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets excited over a jar of powdered gold as he believes it is worth a lot of money, and an explosive acid test is poised to reveal all.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer calls in their lawyer to settle a row over a fake receipt, but Les has a trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Dave Carraro, captain of Tuna.com, finds his first fishing spot of the season. However, his day is interrupted by an unwelcome visitor. Tyler McLaughlin, skipper of the Pin Wheel, has headed south to invade Gloucester waters, with the expressed intent of catching more blue fin tuna than Dave.

programme.title: Football: A Brief History by Alfie Allen
programme.desc: Part two of two. Football's journey from the First World War onward, as it became embroiled in a power struggle that dragged it from post-war times and into the modern era.

programme.title: Greatest Moments in Football
programme.sub-title: Bring Me the Head of Diego Maradona
programme.desc: Documentary about Diego Maradona, a talented and accomplished player, but recalled by many for directing a goal into the England net using his hand at the 1986 World Cup.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary learns a harsh lesson about Dave at auctions in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, while Rene puts a secret strategy to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary is forced far out of her comfort zone when the buyers head to Indio, California. Lockers in this desert town hold many treasures, but it remains to be seen who will buy them.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Arthur Smith, Doon Mackichan, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies answer host Stephen Fry's questions on crime, cuisine and the contents of the Queen's handbag, with points awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Highlights from the third series of the comedy panel show presented by Rob Brydon. Featuring team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack alongside guests including Fern Britton, Ken Livingstone, Davina McCall, Russell Howard and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Fern Britton, Richard E Grant, Sanjeev Bhaskar and Martin Clunes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Victoria Coren Mitchell, Sue Perkins and the Rev Richard Coles join regular panellist Alan Davies on the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of knights and knaves, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O'Briain, Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Milton Jones and Ed Gamble to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines, through stand-up spots and improvised games. First aired in September 2015.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Highlights from the third series of the comedy panel show presented by Rob Brydon. Featuring team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack alongside guests including Fern Britton, Ken Livingstone, Davina McCall, Russell Howard and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Dan and Anna are behind a driver refusing to stop after they spot him smashing into a parked car. When the driver brakes, the pair swiftly realise that the car is about to ram them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank attempt to buy from a handyman who lives on a unique homestead, but the handyman's deal making could end the pick before it begins.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are pitted against the Taylors in San Pedro, where they bid on shipping containers worth a fortune.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Dan gambles on a lot he might later regret in when the gang visits Milton Keynes, while Nat lets her heart rule her head on a sale.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Detroit, Frank takes a big risk on one of the greatest pieces he has ever seen, and Mike acquires a Purple Heart along with a very special mission.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and the team face more challenges in the form of two vintage Harley-Davidson motorcycles which are pursued in Pennsylvania.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Jay rides in rock legend Sammy Hagar's 'I Can't Drive 55' Ferrari, and chauffeurs Kelly Rowland in a vintage Bentley.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In a first for the show, James May shocks the rest of the team when he puts his foot firmly on the accelerator of a Bugatti Veyron. Meanwhile, a case of bad driving and appalling trousers results in all three presenters getting thrown off a golf course. Actor Hugh Grant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to the countryside where they harness a group of hi-tech tractors and try to cultivate their own source of fuel. Meanwhile, the Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 is put through its paces, and actress Kristin Scott Thomas is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat builds in darkness to meet his deadline. Andre and Joel have a problem when the forklift they need to finish a store gazebo does not fit through the door.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie hits San Antonio to sample the finest Tex-Mex food and a gigantic chicken fried steak - with no chicken. He also tests whether he has the moves for TV show Ninja Warrior.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes a look at off-road models and test-drives the Bentley Flying Spur. There is also an attempt to drive a Jeep across a lake, a comparison of petrol and diesel-fuelled BMW 5 series vehicles, and Davina McCall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets out to discover if driving a Lamborghini Murcielago roadster gives drivers the same kick as 12 angry bulls, and whether the Top Gear theme tune can be played with engines. The Ford F150 SVT Lightning pick-up is put through its paces, the world's greatest power sliders hit the track, and Timothy Spall is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actress and presenter Mel Giedroyc, heavyweight boxer David Haye, actor-musician Martin Kemp and comedian Romesh Ranganathan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed host Rob Brydon's liar of the week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents, as regular team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by one-time Bake Off champion Nadiya Hussain, comic and actor Michael Smiley, and comedians Bob Mortimer and Diane Morgan. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory and the dubious honour of being dubbed the liar of the week.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Arthur Smith, Doon Mackichan, Andy Hamilton and Alan Davies answer host Stephen Fry's questions on crime, cuisine and the contents of the Queen's handbag, with points awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the comedy panel quiz, with questions relating to animals that start with the letter P. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by comedian Phill Jupitus, broadcaster Danny Baker and actress Teri Hatcher, who all try to come up with interesting answers.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, John Sessions, Alexander Armstrong and Alan Davies provide imaginative answers to host Stephen Fry's questions on topics including cheating, caravans and cuckoo clocks.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The 1415 Battle of Agincourt and its Band of Brothers. Henry V's victory against a numerically superior French army ushered in a new period in the Hundred Years' War.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The spies who worked during the American Civil War, including Elizabeth van Lew, whose effective network even smuggled out messages in hollow eggs.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Dunwich, Suffolk, which is slowly being lost to coastal erosion. In a bid to ascertain whether the town dates back to Anglo-Saxon times, they dig one of the deepest trenches they have attempted, while Mick Aston, keen to understand the layout of the vanishing settlement, uses sophisticated sonar technology to search beneath the waves.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Newmarket - The First King of Racing
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Newmarket, where they dig in the heart of the historic Suffolk town in search of the remains of Charles II's racing stables. A mechanical horse and a visit to Ladies' Day add to the excitement, but with limited time and a layer of concrete covering the site, the task proves to be problematic.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: A First World War story in which German soldiers retreated from angels, examining the possibility of mass hallucinations, divine intervention or something stranger.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Railways built to cross inhospitable conditions, including the San Diego desert, one of Switzerland's highest mountains, and an infamous jungle railway built by prisoners of war.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Newmarket - The First King of Racing
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Newmarket, where they dig in the heart of the historic Suffolk town in search of the remains of Charles II's racing stables. A mechanical horse and a visit to Ladies' Day add to the excitement, but with limited time and a layer of concrete covering the site, the task proves to be problematic.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: A First World War story in which German soldiers retreated from angels, examining the possibility of mass hallucinations, divine intervention or something stranger.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How railway engineers have crossed valleys, canyons and waterways, including the Forth Bridge and a viaduct in rural New Zealand.

programme.title: Queen Elizabeth's Secret Agents
programme.desc: A look at the secret network behind Queen Elizabeth I's 40-year reign and the world's first secret service run by her spymasters Robert and William Cecil..

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a children's home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. When an artist's impression of a skeleton found in an archaeological dig matches one of the youngsters, the team tries to determine the identity of the paedophile. Starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers decide to go to a local brothel in Hong Kong, but the visit has unforeseen consequences. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colonel Fortune is worried about the prospect of merging with another regiment, and Second Lieutenant Kate Butler faces hostility from the Marines during an exercise.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom and Ed put Chrissie's loyalty to the test as Zubin and Ric investigate the heart transplant incident - which someone is going to have to take responsibility for. Diane reaches a milestone, Lisa anxiously waits to hear about her promotion and the secrets that have been building up over the past few months finally erupt following an attempt to separate conjoined twins.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Alan Kennedy is in custody but the Sun Hill coppers will soon have to release him unless they can find some hard evidence linking him to the rapes. Determined to extract a confession, Samantha resorts to the unorthodox psychological technique of donning a mini-skirt and revealing blouse - will it be enough to make him crack? Elsewhere, tragedy strikes as Adam attends a summer party held to improve community relations.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant has reservations about abandoning his holiday with Sharon at the last minute, but is determined to show he puts her wishes first.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur Fowler was never too happy at Pete Beale billeted on his family, but is Arthur's life going to get any better without him?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve, Jude finds her locker broken into and all her credit cards and money taken. It transpires the thief is Matt's father, and he implores her not to involve the police. Elsewhere, Daniel gets himself into Mike's bad books for queue-hopping one of the patients from a fund-holding GP.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie enters the political arena, but a murder soon stops his campaign dead in its tracks. Jersey-based detective drama, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The department store starts an insurance scheme, prompting the staff to get in shape for the medical. Comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike and the team are reacquainted with some familiar faces when investigating a suspicious suicide at the Brokenwood Women's Prison.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 16-year-old case of an infamous getaway driver convicted of murdering his wife when new evidence suggests it could have been a miscarriage of justice. But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.

programme.title: Path To Power
programme.desc: Mark Austin is on the road presenting live from a different location around Britain in the run up to the General Election. With reaction to the election campaign and all the day's main news from home and abroad.

programme.desc: Mark Austin is on the road presenting live from a different location around Britain in the run up to the General Election. With reaction to the election campaign and all the day's main news from home and abroad.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: This time, the comedian meets an agoraphobic dog who is too scared to go outside, before an unusually quiet chihuahua arrives with a suspected injury to her leg. Later, Paul is introduced to a group of four Japanese chin crosses who have not being getting on well with each other and need to be separated.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland visit Chiddingstone Castle in Kent, where they invite three teams of enthusiasts to compete to find the most rare and valuable items. Whoever wins each round gets first choice in the Masterpiece Challenge, a room filled with antiques, one of which is worth more than £10,000. At the end of the show each team reveals what its members think is the masterpiece and whoever chooses the most masterpieces wins £1,000

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Conservative and Unionist Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Graham is suspicious of Kim, Bob gets an exciting idea and Nicola is sympathetic.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria and Gary deal with the news of her pregnancy, while Geoff and Yasmeen's announcement sets alarm bells ringing for Tim. Elsewhere, the Barlows grow concerned for Daniel, and Rita's thrilled when she bumps into Norris and he agrees to pop in for a cuppa, but he can't stay long as he's meeting Freda.

programme.title: The X Factor: The Band
programme.desc: Simon Cowell is certainly not one to let the grass grow. Just over a week since crowning the winner of Celebrity X Factor, he returns with this second spin-off from the original singing contest, concentrating on groups. The music mogul is aware that so far, groups from The X Factor have sold more than 400 million records, so in this show, which continues on Wednesday, he is looking for undiscovered talent to form a pop group to sign to his record label and hopefully follow in the footsteps of One Direction, Fifth Harmony and Little Mix.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jimmy de Ville head to Korea to find out how it made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason Plato hits the track in an Alpine A110

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini rescues a Jaguar 120 after a recluse's car-collecting becomes a hoarding habit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: An ownership dispute hampers car restorer Wayne Carini's purchase of a rare Ferrari 275 GS.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of two million gallons of volatile chemicals exploding, and a daring BMX freestyler plummeting from a 50ft cliff. Ron Pitts presents a documentary series investigating the natural disasters and accidents that have caused large amounts of damage, from tornados to plane crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts goes behind the scenes of more moments of destruction, including storm chasers who run into trouble, a paint factory that explodes and a plane crash at sea.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill Carlton and his team give a purple '55 Chevy truck a modern update, with a modified hood and scoop, a handmade interior and new wood bed.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A 1965 Chevy Malibu SS was the first car Brian bought himself. Now, a seventh grade maths and science teacher, Brian uses muscle cars to inspire young minds to learn.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How does a helicopter loop the loop? Plus, learn how a 200,000 square metre ball park in the hottest city in the US is cooled?.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Actor Terry O'Quinn pursues plausible explanations behind the world's most baffling disappearances, beginning with the MH370 Malaysia Airlines disaster of 2014.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A team of treasure hunters searches an island somewhere off the south eastern coast of Brazil for millions of dollars' worth of Incan gold.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: After the birth of Daniel's child, the Rookies return to Coober Pedy. Kelly and Al battle the clock, the weather and a deadly cactus, in their hunt for the most valuable opal.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in East Anglia with Nick, who's mad about Morris Minors. However, he also loves motorbikes, both British and Japanese, as well as vintage bicycles. Henry and Sam spot a few bikes they like, one in particular may need some serious restoration.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in Henry's home county of Oxfordshire in search of new bargains. They meet three brothers with containers full of bikes, plus many tractors, trucks and other trinkets. Sam is keen on getting a motorbike and Henry agrees, but Henry also has his eye on something else….

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China works on restoring Mike Brewer's Mercedes 190-E, which features a Cosworth engine, incorporating a new suspension system and track rod end.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues work on the Mercedes. Jobs remaining before the car can be resold by Mike Brewer include fitting a set of tyres and a new exhaust.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The duo relocate across the Atlantic, and Mike Brewer heads to Chicago in search of a rust-free Pontiac GTO - a rare car that he knows will be perfect for kicking off Edd China's US-based workshop.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: The afternoon session on day one of the fourth staging of the event, which comes from Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring matches in the first round.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to the US to hunt for a DeLorean DMC-12, a car that ceased production in 1982. Once he has acquired one, Edd China is given the task of restoring the stainless steel-clad vehicle, which was manufactured in Belfast.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate to move more rock, the rookies get a lesson in the dangerous art of bomb-making. Plus, Kelly is forced to sell her precious reserve of stones.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a 13th-century manor house in Yorkshire, Drew Pritchard uncovers a wartime flag with a medical history. He also visits a neo-gothic cathedral in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Yogi risks a showdown with the law as he heads into South Australia. Elsewhere, Steve is under pressure with a truck out of action, and a run to a place he has never been to.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Railroad
programme.desc: Canadian Pacific freight crews tackle one of their most challenging loads to date as the team attempts to haul a 210-tonne reactor on an epic cross country journey.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes involved in using paraffin to make Gouda cheese, the building of powerful Scania trucks, and how the world's biggest DNA database helps to solve crime.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Exploring the creation of classical guitars and fast tractor mowing machines. Plus, how climbers maintain the blades on wind turbines.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: Jane and Lisa share news regarding the exhumation with a group of Hicks babies that have questioned whether he was in fact their biological father.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: Wendy and her team encounter unexpected challenges with the exhumation. After the exhumation, Sallie and the Hicks babies learn the DNA results.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-two Nikki Whitehead, who was killed in her own home. Police suspected she may have known her killer, resorting to polygraphs and CCTV footage to help reveal the horrific truth.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The September 2011 murders of Roy Napier, his estranged wife Angela, their two adult children and neighbour Henry Smith. Gunman David Ison had earlier argued with Napier over his decision to add $2 to the price of prescription pills he was selling.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1993 investigation into the murder of a 74-year-old man in his home, revealing how evidence linked the crime to an escaped prisoner and his girlfriend.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The vets risk their lives by rushing to the aid of the people and pets of Flagstaff, Arizona, which is in the grip of a raging forest fire.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride tries on over 100 dresses in the search for the perfect look, while a woman getting married on a beach needs a gown that will cover her bare feet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pregnant Tisa looks for a dress that makes her feel sexy, while Emily, who is also expecting, tries on her gown for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Donnetta brings 12 friends to help her find a dress that puts her in the spotlight, though her unruly group threatens to silence her own voice. Meanwhile, another customer looks for a gown that will show off her figure.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A bird is brought to the clinic bleeding, and Chris Brown soon discovers it has a habit that puts its life in danger.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown struggles to save a Labrador puppy that requires urgent attention after eating snail bait, which is threatening to shut down its system.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: An undercover investigation leads the team to the shocking discovery of eight dogs tied to metal chains, dog-fighting paraphernalia, illegal drugs and a gun.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A dog arrives at the shelter after being attacked by another animal and left without veterinary treatment.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of business entrepreneurs Hilary Devey and Saira Khan, as they try to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old nursing student Maura Murray, who went missing in February 2004 minutes after being involved in a traffic collision. For no apparent reason she had driven 144 miles north from her campus and the accident was the second road incident she had suffered within two days.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: Michele Whitaker: The Last Truck Stop
programme.desc: The disappearance of Michele Whitaker who vanished in August 2002 after hitching a ride from a South Carolina truck stop. Convinced no one would be troubled at her departure, she made a new life on America's west coast, and only contacted relatives after a friend made her aware of a missing persons inquiry in her name six years later.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of staff at Bridals by Lori in the Atlanta suburb of Sandy Springs, as well as meeting customers searching for the perfect wedding dress. Bride-to-be Haley clashes with her grandmother over her choice of gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Fashion director Monte comes to the rescue when a client lands in hot water, while 35-year-old Erin's mother reminds her she is not a young bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Cancer survivor Joya's dream dress is beyond her budget, but her friends offer support. Ria knows exactly which gown she wants, but her picky entourage are not keen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kari wants a conservative dress, but her mother is looking for something more revealing, while Nita's couture tastes do not fit with her mother's off-the-rack budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Tensions run high between a bride and her demanding wedding planner, and the youngest sibling of a large family fights for her right to be heard and stands up to her sisters.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two women compete to be named maid of honour, and a bride struggles to wrestle control of her big day from a groomsmaid intent on stealing the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop, while another customer seeks to combine the styles of Audrey Hepburn and Joan Jett.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Designer Henry Roth wants to provide a customer with a perfect gown, while another bride brings her wedding planner to her fitting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles with a head teacher, squeezes into a hoarder's shed and takes a tour of a grand country house as he searches for more saleable items.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items from a recycling centre in Walsall, with Kev Paxton and Simion Hawtin-Smith helping him transform a retro chair, gate rods and four dining chairs.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Ashley, who at 670 pounds is desperate to save her life and her marriage to husband David. She is also hopeful weight-loss surgery can give her the chance for a family of her own.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns start to worry when it becomes clear there is still a lot of work to do and there is only 48 hours to go until the ceremony takes place.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Katie's house, relationships and financial situation are in tatters. Feeling down and out, she recruits the help of an unlikely duo in her exes, Kris and Kieran.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.
